name: TheAtlantic
text: The Islamic State turned Facebook into a global marketplace for looted artifacts. These vigilante archaeologists are trying to stop it, @Jenna_Scatena reports. https://t.co/3fWxHR0bi0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books by Kiley Reid, Hilary Mantel, Margaret Atwood, and more Booker Prize nominees and winners in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing, by @latham_tori: https://t.co/Sp5NfsPlO9

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If campuses reopen to students but most faculty teach remotely, students and administrators who show up might see more clearly how staff are the connective tissue holding campuses together," writes @jselingo. https://t.co/lkpo3NT0QV

name: TheAtlantic
text: The South China Morning Post is arguably the world’s most important newspaper for what it tells us about media freedoms as China’s power grows. @TMcLaughlin3 looks inside a newsroom at the edge of autocracy: https://t.co/pRgBtqYgj1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Archaeology operates within a contemporary setting and can contribute to conversations we are having today about how history is memorialized," @dmcarballo tells @DavidFrum: https://t.co/O9OwdtFrFV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We cannot turn back the clock to a mythical 'Judeo-Christian America' in order to chart a new course for America’s moral imagination," @Jbloeffler writes: https://t.co/HzAxkyfafE

name: TheAtlantic
text: The former U.S. poet laureate Natasha Trethwey’s new memoir is awash in metaphor, its language a meditation on the role that poetry—and storytelling more broadly—can play in reconciling trauma, Hannah Giorgis writes. https://t.co/ukG90wltxT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For 15 years we've just been dead in the water." Cosmologists who question the existence of dark matter have spent decades looking for a plausible alternative. Now, @walkingthedot reports, they may have found one: https://t.co/oyv90Zg70Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’ve been hauling balloons into my apartment recently, great gaggles of them, in the interest of general mood elevation. There have been occasions, too, moments to mark: birthdays, graduations, whatever. They’re over. But the balloons remain...." https://t.co/CGichNDntM

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: The South China Morning Post is arguably the world’s most important newspaper, for what it tells us about media freedoms as China’s power grows. @TMcLaughlin3 looks inside a newsroom at the edge of autocracy: https://t.co/4eSJPEV65A

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TMclaughlin3: “That was frustrating,” one current reporter told me “they’ve given an impression that SCMP is anti protesters. As journalists, we should never be pro or against protesters.” A look at some tensions inside Hong Kong’s biggest English language newspaper. https://t.co/Iugxr7Y8t0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @davidfrum: I wrote long-form about entering Canada and the rules of self-isolation here. 

The summary is *not* that Canada did a uniquely good job. It didn't, there were plenty of mistakes. The moral is that Trump and his pet governors did a uniquely lousy job. 
 https://t.co/HFmWc6vkS1

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidfrum: Latest in @TheAtlantic : an interview with @dmcarballo about his exciting new book on the fall of the Aztec empire and the creation of modern Mexico https://t.co/sfRWu1wHSz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: .@AnnieLowrey identifies a new species out in the wild https://t.co/cBILZnmnWW

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump feels he needs to portray “the suburbs” as under an imminent threat. But his racist dog-whistling ignores a complex demographic history. @bgzimmer writes: https://t.co/PRbJUBe1rz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As long as America proves capable of delivering a safe and effective vaccine to its citizens, it will contain the coronavirus," @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/NUZMcYMThP

name: TheAtlantic
text: Because school closures created a crisis for working parents, it’s tempting to see adding school back into the equation as the solution, @ashleyfetters writes. But there are less dangerous ways to help families than fully reopening schools as they were: https://t.co/ucOqu1FRLj

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2020 may offer Democrats their best chance yet to take back state legislatures across the country, just in time for redistricting to begin in 2021, @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/Jl1jESbzSt
